description: A deeply strange ritual site on the southern side of Castle Hill inside the Roman walled town of Cambridge. A 2nd - 3rd CE large subterranean shrine that held numerous animal and infant deposits, evidence of burning, and various other objects. A pentagonal timber structure to the eat of the deposits was also identified as a shrine.
bibliography: Alex, er, and Pullinger. “Roman Cambridge: Excavations on Castle Hill 1956-1988.” Proceedings of the Cambridge Antiquarian Society 88 (1999).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Cambridge, Castle Hill (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
